Body: Persian āhista آهسته “slow, gentle” begins with a long ā. The Indo-European privative prefix *ṇ- appears in Iranian (and still in Middle Persian) as short a- before consonants and an- before vowels. In New Persian initial a- becomes zero and initial an- become n-. So it should be obvious that the long ā- in NP āhista is not the privative prefix.
